title: Ben Mitchell (rugby union)
text:
Ben Mitchell (born 6 April 1994) is an English-born Irish professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who is currently a <a href="lock%20%28rugby%20union%29">lock</a>. , he is with the United States team <a href="San%20Diego%20Legion">San Diego Legion</a>, having previously played for <a href="Youghal">Youghal RFC</a>, <a href="University%20College%20Cork">University College Cork</a> in <a href="Ireland">Ireland</a>, the <a href="Gentlemen%20of%20Aspen%20RFC">Gentlemen of Aspen RFC</a> of <a href="Colorado">Colorado</a> and <a href="Austin%20Elite">Austin Elite</a>.
Career.
Mitchell was educated at the independent <a href="Midleton%20College">Midleton College</a> and then at University College Cork (UCC), both of which have produced leading rugby players. At UCC, he studied Commerce and joined <a href="University%20College%20Cork%20R.F.C.">University College Cork RFC</a>. In his first year and a half, he played in the university club's under-20 team, then in 2014 joined the seniors in the <a href="All-Ireland%20League%20%28rugby%20union%29">All Ireland League</a>, remaining on the team until halfway through the 2017/18 season. In 2015/2016, UCC RFC was promoted to Division 1 of the League. In 2016 and 2017, Mitchell was selected for the Irish Universities to play the English Universities. He was UCC RFC player of the year for the 2016/17 season and played his last game for the team in November 2017. At the end of the 2016 AIL season Mitchell was selected on the bench for a <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster Rugby</a> A/Development side against the Irish under 20s team 
In 2016 and 2017, Mitchell was a summer player for the Gentlemen of Aspen in the Rocky Mountain Summer League, starring in the "Ruggerfest" tournament in 2017. In October 2017 he signed a two-year contract with Austin Elite to join the team for the inaugural <a href="Major%20League%20Rugby">Major League Rugby</a> season of 2018 and was re-signed in January 2019.
In 2018 and 2019 Mitchell played as lock for Austin in every game but one. In 2019 he became team captain, taking over from <a href="Andrew%20Suniula">Andrew Suniula</a>. In 2018 Mitchell was named on the All-MLR 1st team and was regarded as the best lock in the competition. 
In 2019 he again achieved All-MLR honors by being named on the All-MLR 2nd team. 
In August 2019 he was signed by <a href="San%20Diego%20Legion">San Diego Legion</a>, in what was seen as a major blow for the Austin franchise. In late 2020 he will qualify for the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">United States national rugby union team</a> by residency in the US and is predicted to be of interest to the selectors.
In 2019 he was named as the Head Coach of the <a href="Gentlemen%20of%20Aspen">Gentlemen of Aspen</a>. He helped the <a href="Gentlemen%20of%20Aspen">Gentlemen of Aspen</a> to the 2021 Ruggerfest title as player/coach.
He was resigned by San Diego Legion for 2020–21.
In October 2021 Mitchell was selected for the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">United States national rugby union team</a> Selects team to play in the Americas Pacific Challenge in Uruguay. Mitchell played in both games in Uruguay against Chile A and Brazil A and was singled out by head coach Mike Tolkin as one of the USA’s standout performers on the tour.
